executive_summary: Tom Hayes discusses a potential Santa Claus rally, a rotation out of the MAG 7 into the unmagnificent 493 (defensives, healthcare, cyclicals, industrials, and energy), and reviews many long-term holdings, highlighting entry points and future potential. He emphasizes a focus on value and buying high-quality assets in dislocated markets.

key_reasons: Santa Claus rally expected from December 15th to 30th.
Tax loss selling season is in the rear view mirror.
Potential for a 13% rally in 2026 according to City Bank, mimicking Morgan Stanley, Deutsche Bank, and Goldman Sachs.

macro_thesis_summary: Hayes anticipates a rotation out of the MAG 7 into other sectors due to decelerating earnings growth in tech and accelerating earnings growth elsewhere. He expects defensives, healthcare, cyclicals, industrials and energy to outperform. He also sees a potential rise in energy prices and emphasizes the importance of dividend payers in an easing cycle. He believes that the market will experience volatility in 2026, but fiscal stimulus and an easing cycle will limit the downside.

key_macro_data_points.value: Rose to 7.4 from 6.4, highest since July 2021
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: Getting a little frothier when they were despondent.

key_macro_data_points.value: Most optimistic since August 2021, rising a net 18%
Fell to a record low of 3.3%
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: Seeing some a little bit of chop here. Makes sense.

key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: We expect staples to move back into vogue in a hurry 100%.

Boeing.thesis_summary: Boeing is a national champion in a duopoly with a large backlog. A new leader with an engineering background is turning the company around, focusing on production and cash flow. The greatest salesman and ultimate closer in the White House is helping to secure deals.
key_metrics: Positive free cash flow of $238 million in the quarter.
Commercial airplane deliveries reached 160 for the quarter, up 38% year-on-year.
Commercial backlog now stands at $535 billion.
787 program continued to stabilize production at seven per month with management expecting to finish the year at eight per month and to move to 10 next year.
Boeing.price_target_or_valuation: Greater than $10 billion of annual free cash flow target.
Boeing.action: Hold. Continue to monitor production and cash flow improvements.

Estee Lauder.thesis_summary: Estee Lauder is experiencing a turnaround with improving revenue, profitability, and margins. Growth in China and digital channels are key drivers. A profit recovery and growth plan is expected to yield significant benefits.
key_metrics: Q1 revenue of $3.48 billion, up 4% year-on-year.
Adjusted operating margins expanded by 300 basis points in Q1 to 7.3%.
Estee Lauder.action: Hold. Monitor progress of the profit recovery and growth plan.

new_or_recent_additions: New healthcare sector position (details to be released after the new year)
risks_and_contrarian_flags: Potential for a 15% correction in 2026 if Kevin Warsh is chosen as Fed chair.
Market is underestimating the risk of a hawkish Fed.
technical_takeaways: Equal weight and Russell Small Cap indexes broke to new highs, indicating good market breadth. Europe breaking out to new highs. Hong Kong consolidating for a move higher. The dollar is resuming its downtrend. Commercial buying in energy futures suggests higher prices in 2026.
